7️⃣ A ballot measure in Chicago

Progressive politicians in Chicago have pushed a tax on real estate transactions to fund homelessness services. The measure has survived a long legal battle. Some context: www.wbez.org/stories/brin...

5️⃣ & 6️⃣: #IL04 and #IL07

Two congressional primaries in which two Democratic incumbents, Danny Davis & Chuy Garcia, are facing challenges from different ideological directions. Also watch #IL12 on the GOP side.

4️⃣ Cleveland's prosecutor race

In a sea of uncontested races in Ohio, this one sticks out. A two-term incumbent with a record of frequently seeking the death penalty & fighting innocence claims is seeking reelection against a progressive challenger. boltsmag.org/cleveland-pr...

3️⃣ This judgeship in Chicago

Chicagoans know how crowded your judicial ballot can get One to watch: Injustice Watch reported on John Poulos, a former police officer with a long track record who is running for a judgeship. www.injusticewatch.org/judges/judic...

2️⃣ Chicago's prosecutor race.

Kim Foxx has been one of the faces of reform prosecutors since 2016. Now she's retiring, with one candidate who says he'd give her an A, and the other candidate who wants to roll back some of her reforms. Some context: boltsmag.org/bail-reform-...
